p: Cano and co-authors [ 45] designed and studied the combination of cellulose nanocrystals (CNC) in polymeric blend of poly(vinyl alcohol) (PVA) and pea starch (2:1 content) blend films, to enhance the physical and functional characteristics and the stability of produced formulations throughout storage, reducing some negative aspects of starch-based films. Specific amounts (1, 3, and 5 wt %) of CNC were selected to modulate the barrier properties of PVA/pea starch based film used as control. No changes in water vapor permeability (WVP) were registered adding the different content of CNC; this behavior can be related to the enhancement in the hydrophilic nature of the films, as also observed by the overall migration levels in polar and non-polar food simulants. The nanocomposites are characterized by lightly rigid and more stretchable behavior, crystallization phenomenon of PVA was moderately reduced by CNC addition [ 45].
